page.title: 0730 YEARS AT PUTTENHAM SCHOOL
page.content: In{1954,}when{Mrs.Jean Ford}became headmistress of{Puttenham Church of {England School,}the building had no electricity and was lit by gas. It had three simple classrooms heated by open fires and ancient stoves, which made the children cough. Mrs. Ford retires in{December 1985}and Puttenham School is very different. When a Civil Defence siren was put in the School grounds it brought the gift of electricity in 1954.The Marwick Hall, built by village effort,is used daily by the children, as is the recreation field which adjoins the school. There is an annexe for the Headteacher and staff, and a swimming pool and craft room were both built with the help of parents. The latest additions have been electronic - a colour television, video recorder and a B.B.C. computer.
